intro: Nicotiana crispula, commonly known as the curly leaf tobacco, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Solanaceae family, which includes other well-known plants like tomatoes and potatoes. The plant is characterized by its distinctive crinkled, wavy leaves and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. It thrives in warm climates and is often cultivated for its ornamental value. Nicotiana crispula is also notable for its historical use in traditional medicine and as a source of nicotine.
